Based on their message, it seems like they might be interested in romantic comedies or dramas that focus more on the relationship aspects than on the plot points.

Some movies from this list that might fit their interests include:

- 'The Notebook' - A classic romantic comedy that tells the story of two star-crossed lovers over several decades.
- 'Pride & Prejudice' - Another classic romantic comedy based on Jane Austen's novel.
- 'Titanic' - An epic romantic drama directed by James Cameron and based on Jack London's novel "The White Fang".
- 'La La Land' - A musical romantic drama directed by Damien Chazelle and starring Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling as the lead characters.
- 'The Fault in Our Stars' - A romantic drama written by John Green and published in 2012. It stars Shailene Woodley and Ansel Elgort as the lead characters.
- 'A Walk to Remember' - A romantic drama written by Nicholas Sparks and first published in 1996. It stars Shane West and Sarah Michelle Gellar as the lead characters.
- 'Crazy Rich Asians' - A romantic comedy film directed by Jon M. Chu and produced by Wanda Cinemas, Singapore Media Entertainment Group (MGM), and Universal Pictures. It stars Henry Goldwyn Jr., Rachel McAdams, Tom Hiddleston, John Cho, Michelle Yeoh, Andrew Garfield, Ben Affleck, etc.
- 'The Vow' - A romantic drama film directed by Peter Weir and produced by Wanda Cinemas, Singapore Media Entertainment Group (MGM), and Universal Pictures. It stars Rachel McAdams, Sam Rockwell, Tom Hiddleston, John Cho, Michelle Yeoh, Andrew Garfield, Ben Affleck, etc.
- 'About Time' - A romantic comedy film directed by Richard Curtis and produced by Wanda Cinemas, Singapore Media Entertainment Group (MGM), Universal Pictures. It stars David Beckham, Richard Gere, Samantha Morton, Rachel McAdams, Tom Hiddleston, John Cho, Michelle Yeoh, Andrew Garfield, Ben Affleck, etc.
- 'The Holiday' - A romantic comedy film directed by Michael Lehmann and produced by Columbia Pictures Corporation. It stars Cameron Diaz, Ashton Kutcher, Jason Bateman, and Matthew Broderick.

- '500 Days of Summer' - A romantic comedy film directed by Marc Webb and written by Mark Ruffalo. It stars Zookeeper Jake Gyllenhaal and Emma Stone as the lead characters.
- "To All the Boys I've Loved Before" - A romantic comedy film directed by Adam Silverberg and written by Jessica Alba, Ashley Judd, & Jennifer Garner. It stars Jennifer Garner as the lead character.
- 'Love, Rosie' - A romantic comedy film directed by Mark Romanek and written by Mark Romanek, David Zabel, & Chris Kattan. It stars Rosie Stone as the lead character.
- "Me Before You" - A romantic comedy film directed by Emir Zadeh and based on Jojo Wright's novel of the same name. It stars Sam Heughness and Emily Blunt as the lead characters.
- "Dear John" - A romantic comedy film directed by Donald Cameroun and based on a short story by Jane Austen. It stars Robert Redford as the lead character.
